Text.p: The [ip]Present System[/pi] refers to the planetary system which your ship is currently in; while the [ip]Hyperspace System[/pi] refers to the system onto which the hyperspace is locked.

There are four possible [ip]Conditions[/pi]: [b]DOCKED[/b] means that you are docked in a space station at the Present System; [b]GREEN[/b] means that there is no immediate danger; [b]YELLOW[/b] indicates enemy ships in the vicinity; Condition [b]RED[/b] signals a high-risk on-going death-type combat situation.

[ip]Legal Status[/pi] refers to your Galactic Police record. If this is [b]CLEAN[/b] you have nothing to worry about, but as an [b]OFFENDER[/b] or, still worse, a [b]FUGITIVE[/b] you are likely to be attacked by police ships.
The [ip]Rating[/pi] is a dispassionate assessment of your performance in combat so far.
Current cash and fuel are also displayed, along with a list of ship fittings.
The status page is always retrievable by pressing the [ip]Status[/pi] button in the navigation bar, or by opening the in-flight menu and choosing [ip]Status[/pi].
